review: For the first 8 months or so of owning everything worked great.  I was able to use plex and watch amazon video on demand flawlessly.  There was no stuttering in video and everything played smoothly at 720p.  I never did end up trying 1080p.  There was minimal lag with the menu which was acceptable considering the price point (it was slower than my Roku but the Roku was 2.5x the cost and a standalone box so expected).About 8 months in the device started restarting randomly regardless of what I was doing.  I'd be in the middle of watching something and then would have to wait for 5 minutes for it to reboot.  I called customer service and was told that this is normal processing and it is fully expected that the device will reboot due to random glitches in the system.  At that point I decided that I was done with the product and threw it awayOverall a great device when it works but if things start going south don't count on Amazon to step up to the plate even when your still within the warranty period.  This also ruined any chance of me purchasing an actual Fire TV.  I'll stick with my Roku 3.
